intro: Psammisia flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sandplant, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of the southern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low moisture. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Psammisia flaviflora plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in its native habitat.
